citation.article-title: Characterization of filamentous Eikelboom type 021N bacteria and description of Thiothrix disciformis sp. nov. and Thiothrix flexilis sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Thiothrix disciformis sp. nov.
Thiothrix disciformis (dis.ci.for'mis. L. masc. n. discus disc; L. n. forma shape; N.L. adj. disciformis disc-shaped, the main cell form)
Cells are rods and form slightly bent multicellular filaments.
Filaments are more than 0.5 mm long and can reach several millimetres.
Colonies are fingerprint-like.
Cell morphology in filaments is variable, particularly for length, and discoid to ovoid shaped cells are often observed.
Cells of the major form are 1.2-3.0 μm in diameter and 0.5-3.0 μm in length.
Elongate and swollen cells are sometimes present in filaments.
Septa are clearly visible between individual cells.
Gram-negative.
A sheath is absent.
Volutin inclusions are not usually observed.
Sudanophilic granules are observed within cells.
Growth occurs in the temperature range 14-32°C and pH range 7.0-7.9, but there is no growth at 4 or 37°C.
Optimum temperature 25-30°C.
Oxidase-positive.
Catalase-positive with violent bubble generation when cells are exposed to hydrogen peroxide.
When cells are grown in the presence of a reduced inorganic sulfur compound, sulfur globules are deposited within invaginations of the cytoplasmic membrane and sulfuric acid is produced.
Reduced inorganic sulfur is not required for growth.

Glucose, fructose, mannose, sucrose, maltose, trehalose, mannitol, succinate, pyruvate, acetate, malate, butyrate, hydroxybutyrate, glutamate, glycerol and aspartate are utilized as sole carbon sources.
Almost all strains utilize citrate and alanine.
No growth occurs with lactate, benzoate, xylose, erythritol, galactose, lactose, melibiose, raffinose, arabinose, rhamnose, ethanol, 1-propanol, sorbitol, formate, gelatin or starch.
Growth is inhibited by 0.5% (w/v) NaCl.
Nitrate is not reduced.
The G+C content of the DNA is 44-45 mol% (HPLC).
The major quinone is UQ-8.
The major fatty acids are C16:1, C16:0 and C18:1.
Isolated from activated sludge suffering from bulking.
The type strain is strain B3-1T (=DSM 14473T=JCM 11364T).
Additional strains are B4-1 (=JCM 11365), B2-7 (=JCM 11362), SCM-A (=JCM 11132), B5-1 (=JCM 11366), B2-8 (=JCM 11363) and OS-F (=JCM 11131).
